snippet: President Obama said he would be “angry” if it turned out that Secret Service agents had solicited prostitutes before a summit in Colombia.
abstract: Pres Obama issues his first public statement about Secret Service employees accused of soliciting prostitutes before summit meeting in Caragena, Columbia; says he will be 'angry' if allegations prove to be true.

byline.contributor: Jackie Calmes contributed reporting from Cartagena, Colombia, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Obama said he would be “angry” if it turned out that Secret Service agents had solicited prostitutes before a summit in Colombia.

headline.seo: Secret Service Scandal Prompts Obama Comment
headline.main: President Speaks Out on Guard Investigation
headline.print_headline: President Speaks Out On Guard Investigation
